results.title: Thinking in action: the De Bono thinking kit
results.brief_description: Edward De Bono believes that everyone can learn to think better and approach work more imaginatively. This course consists of six segments forming the core of a training session, a students’ manual and instructors’ manual. 1. Creativity, Design and Innovation. - 2. Improvement, Review and Productivity. - 3. People, Communication and Negotiation. - 4. Problems, Crisis and Opportunities. - 5. Decision, Choice and Evaluation. - 6. Action, Planning and Implementation.

results.title: Thinking about drinking
results.brief_description: Presents the facts about alcoholic beverages with emphasis on their effects on the nervous system and behaviour. An alcoholic is a person who drinks so much that it interferes with their work and health, and alcoholism is a disease which constitutes a major health problem.

results.title: Think twice: they're confusing you
results.brief_description: Illustrates kinds of faulty or misleading information, such as oversimplification, distortions of fact, and logical fallacies. Designed to encourage critical thinking about the information which permeates public and personal communication. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Think twice: the persuasion game
results.brief_description: This film presents vignettes which dramatise ways in which the power of persuasion is used to influence the public. Appeals are made to one’s emotions. Fear, vanity, pride, justice and one’s desire to belong are utilised. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Think of the future
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information for European Productivity Agency and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon contrasting improved modern conditions of work with the “good old days” when working and living conditions were in fact very much inferior. Only by increased production can the present high living standard be maintained and improved; to this end co-operation between workers and management is essential.

results.title: Thingumajigs = Trouvailles ou bizarreries
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a film about creations, and the inventors who ride them, drive them, row them, and look at them. Unpredictable, the creations sometimes develop minds of their own. Sound film without words.

results.title: Things to do in Denver when you're dead
results.creator_credit: Gary Fleder, Cary Woods and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a motley gang of mobsters with names like Jimmy the Saint, Pieces, Franchise, Easy Wind and Critical Bill, all who are trying to go straight but are doomed to be called back for one final job. Jimmy the Saint’s (Andy Garcia) “Afterlife Advice” business for terminally ill clients (where they can videotape future advice for their loved ones) is falling into a hole rapidly. Needing some finance Jimmy turns to his old boss The Man With The Plan (Christopher Walken) for help but in return he has to do a favour for The Man - “rough up” The Man’s son’s ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend! Jimmy calls in the old Gang and together they hatch an elaborate plan, a plan that ends up going horribly wrong. Stars Christopher Lloyd, William Forsythe, Bill Nunn, Treat Williams, Jack Warden, Steve Buscemi, Fairuza Balk.
